content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of unknown primary origin with pleural and peritoneal involvement

Staging:
Stage IVB disease
CD117 positive on immunohistochemistry
Diagnosis confirmed January 2024

Treatment history:
Cycles 1-3 carboplatin/gemcitabine completed March 2024
Partial response on CT imaging April 2024

Current situation:
Seen today for treatment review
Stable radiological disease but deteriorating symptoms
Increasing breathlessness and abdominal discomfort
Performance status declined from 1 to 2

Clinical assessment:
New right pleural effusion requiring drainage
Oxygen saturations 92% on room air
Mild peripheral edema

Plan:
Discontinue carboplatin/gemcitabine due to clinical deterioration
Commence weekly paclitaxel 80mg/m2
Pleural drainage to be arranged
Follow up in 2 weeks with repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis

cancer_timeline.value: CT showing partial response to treatment
Development of new right pleural effusion

patient_facts.value: Right pleural effusion with oxygen saturations 92% on room air

status_updates.value: Stage IVB squamous cell carcinoma of unknown primary with pleural and peritoneal metastases. Clinical deterioration despite initial partial response to carboplatin/gemcitabine
Stable radiological disease but clinical deterioration with new pleural effusion
Discontinuing carboplatin/gemcitabine due to clinical deterioration, switching to weekly paclitaxel 80mg/m2
Deterioration in performance status from PS 1 to PS 2
Review in clinic in 2 weeks with imaging
